name: pbeez
text: Achewood has so many side-stories and characters with minor involvement with the main characters that I hope against hope that there will be a Smuckles Family Tree comic done in the same vein as "The Life and Times of Scrooge McDuck"

name: saru
text: That comic was awesome .

name: littlefatdog
text: I love this concept, that the best blues player is logically the least lucky, regardless of anything else.

name: crinklebat
text: Ohhh, the blues.

name: bovine
text:
here is an old recording of goodnight irene btw.

http://www-cdf.lbl.gov/~av/gI10-34_78-av31-deriv51-RIAA-mcm.wav

name: spinynorman
text:
Yeah, I was about to bring that up. Tom's voice really suits the song, since he sounds like (and looks like) he just walked out of the 20's or so.

That is a huge barroom favorite. I'm sort of a skinny, intellectual-looking kid, but imagine me with one arm around a biker and one arm around my rather large and luberjackish friend, swaying back and forth bellowing out IREEEENE GOODNIIIIIGHT IREEEENE!

Oh, the joys of music. And whiskey.

name: fineoakstructure
text: I got confused and tried to sing it to the tune of "Come On Eileen."

text: This presents an entirely different image of the aforementioned trio.

name: curranesque
text:
"...suddenly Rustmouth wasn't the unluckiest man alive anymore. Just his luck."

mmm mmm mmm sweet irony

name: chetyre
text: Trying to commit suicide by rolling off the bed is such a depressing mental image.  Truly worthy of a blues artist.

name: cab234
text: I love the idea that the crowd at Silent Bird's show would let him suffer paying for his wooden tongue, since if they each gave a dollar and pooled the money then they'd be buying out Wallace's blues-cred.
